intro: Humboltia trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces small, triangular fruits that contain seeds. Humboltia trifida is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appearance.
